business.headline: Concern for world, won't benefit US much: Ex-RBI Governor on Trump tariff threatSpeaking to India Today TV, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that US President Donald Trump's tariff plans could harm global economic stability, increase costs, and deter foreign investment.
A decade of budget evolution under ModiCoalition dynamics could influence future budgetary decisions, particularly in the welfare sector. Will the government maintain its current priorities?

What to expect from Budget 2025: Growth, taxes, and fiscal realities in numbersFY25's deficit is projected at 4.9 per cent of the GDP, or Rs 16.1 trillion. Despite slower economic growth, the government is expected to stick to its fiscal discipline plan.

IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariffs, impact on global growth, AI and moreDuring the interview, Gita Gopinath discussed the potential impact of US President Donald Trump's plan to impose new trade tariffs, global growth, bilateral trade between India and America, cryptocurrency and more.

IMF's Gita Gopinath suggests India to lower tariffs and focus on domestic reformsGita Gopinath suggested that India should consider lowering its tariffs, not only to counter the tariff concerns raised by former US President Donald Trump, but also to boost its own economic growth.

Sensex, Nifty crash: Bears dominate amid Trump's tariff threat; Zomato down 11%Share Market Crash: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged 1235.08 points to close at 75,838.36, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 320.10 points to end at 23,024.65.

Sensex crashes as Trump 2.0 spooks D-Street investors. 3 things to knowStock market crash: The Sensex tumbled 1,300 points to 75,773 at around 2:45 pm, while the Nifty50 fell below 23,000. All other broader market indices also collapsed during the trading session.

India could afford to cut back...: IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariff threatGita Gopinath said that India's focus should be on domestic reforms rather than tariff battles as it looks to become a global hub for manufacturing.

Anshuman Mishra shares insights on Donald Trump's second term inaugurationInvestment banker and political strategist Anshuman Mishra provides exclusive insights from Washington DC on Donald Trump's second term inauguration.

Donald Trump's uncertain tariff plan keeps Dalal Street on edge. 3 key takeawaysUS President Donald Trump has decided not to immediately implement tariffs, leading to uncertainty among market investors around the world, including Dalal Street.

Adar Poonawalla shares his views on 70-hour workweek debateCEO of Serum Institute of India, Adar Poonawalla, shared his views on the ongoing debate about the 70-hour workweek, stating that human beings can not be productive after continuously working for 8-9 hours.

Adar Poonawalla on 70-hour workweek: Humans can't be productive beyond 8-9 hoursThe CEO of Serum Institute mentioned that there's no substitute for hard work but the quality of work, and working strategically is of importance.

Explained: Why Paytm share price fell 7% today and what's nextPaytm stock price: The drop in Paytm's share price came after the company reported its Q3FY25 results. Read to find out how brokerages rated Paytm's Q3 results and how the company's stock will perform in future.

Narayana Murthy clarifies 70-hour workweek remark: It's not wrong but is a choiceAfter stirring up a fierce debate on social media, Narayana Murthy has now suggested that the 70-hour workweek is a personal choice and should not be imposed on others.

Sensex tumbles over 800 points. Is Trump 2.0 behind stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was trading 800.18 points lower at 76,281 at 11:12 am, while the NSE Nifty50 dipped 200 points to 23,144.75.

Explained: Why Zomato shares are down 10% and what investors should doZomato shares were trading 9.42% lower at Rs 218.25 at 10:22 am. Shares of the food delivery giant had also declined in the previous session.

Stocks to watch today: Tata Technologies, Waaree Renewable, Reliance PowerAmid all the news regarding Donald Trump's tariff threat, several stocks such as Tata Technologies, Waaree Renewable, L&T Finance, Reliance Power, Vedanta will be in the spotlight today.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT and FMCG stocks drive early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 98.36 points to 77,171.80, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.20 points to 23,413.95 as of 9:30 AM.

Stallion India IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing dateStallion India IPO allotment status: Investors who have subscribed to Stallion India IPO can check their allotment status on the online portals of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.
Will Donald Trump's second term spark volatility on Dalal Street?US President Donald Trump on Monday said he would impose tariffs and taxes on "foreign countries" "to enrich" Americans.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Concern for world, won't benefit US much: Ex-RBI Governor on Trump tariff threatSpeaking to India Today TV, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that US President Donald Trump's tariff plans could harm global economic stability, increase costs, and deter foreign investment.

Ageless Novak Djokovic dumps out Carlos Alcaraz for special 50 Australian Open 2025: 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic defeated third seed Carlos Alcaraz 4-6, 6-4, 6-3, 6-4 in the men's singles quarter-final to reach his 50th Grand Slam semi-final on Tuesday.

Bandage on neck, cast on wrist: Saif Ali Khan back home 5 days after attackSaif Ali Khan was discharged from Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital six days after he was stabbed inside his Bandra home. He was spotted arriving at his residence with a bandage on his neck and a cast on his hand.

66 killed in fire at Turkey ski resort, guests jump out of windowsThe fire broke out at around 3.30 am in the restaurant of the 12-storey Grand Kartal hotel in the resort of Kartalkaya in Bolu province, officials and reports said. The cause of the fire was under investigation.

Fur-ious revenge: Dog scratches car that hit him in Madhya PradeshA dog left scratches on a car that had hit it in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar in an unusual tale of revenge. A video of the incident also surfaced online.

Six planets to align in the sky tonight: Will they be visible in India?Although the planets won't form a perfectly straight line, their simultaneous visibility in a single part of the sky will be an awe-inspiring spectacle.

Press Lotus, see electricity vanish: Arvind Kejriwal warns voters against BJPFormer Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that the city currently gets 24-hour electricity. He, however, warned voters against voting for the BJP, saying that electrcity would disappear if they pressed the Lotus button during Assembly elections.

Kids up till 1 am, Novak Djokovic interrupts interview for daddy duty Australian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic entertained on the court and off it on Tuesday, putting on a show against third seed Carlos Alcaraz. The Serb interrupted his on-court interview to have a heartwarming chat with his kids, who were at Rod Laver Arena.
Fact Check: Was Jaishankar asked to move to the back during Trump's inauguration?The full video makes it clear that the woman asked a cameraperson to move to the back, not S Jaishankar.

Day 10 Highlights: Novak Djokovic outlasts Carlos Alcaraz to reach semi-finalAustralian Open 2025, Day 10 Highlights: Novak Djokovic has beaten Carlos Alcaraz in the quarterfinal to book a berth in the semi-final. Aryna Sabalenka has defeated Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova in the quarter-final and will now face Paula Badosa. Earlier, Rohan Bopanna and Zhang Shui have lost the quarter-final against John Peers and Olivia Gadecki.

Odisha couple killed after stepping on live wires set for poaching wild animalsBodies of the couple, identified as Bolaram Galel and Bala Galel, were found entangled in live wires allegedly set up by poachers to kill wild animals.

Shinde Sena MP seeks audit of illegal Bangladeshis in MaharashtraIn a letter to Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, Shiv Sena MP Milind Deora called for a "comprehensive audit" of illegal Bangladeshi immigrants residing in the state.

IMF's Gita Gopinath suggests India to lower tariffs and focus on domestic reformsGita Gopinath suggested that India should consider lowering its tariffs, not only to counter the tariff concerns raised by former US President Donald Trump, but also to boost its own economic growth.

Why 7,25,000 Indians are shivering in the US. No, it's not the biting coldThere are approximately 14 million undocumented immigrants, including 7,25,000 Indians, in the US. The US had already sent back 1,500 Indians in the financial year 2024 under a lenient Biden administration. With the return of Donald Trump, the thousands of illegal Indian immigrants in the US are on the edge.

India vs England T20I Series: Live Streaming, Squads, all you need to knowIndia are all set to lock horns with England in a five-match T20I series beginning from January 22 at Eden Gardens, Kolkata. Here are all the details you need to know about the series.

India could afford to cut back...: IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariff threatGita Gopinath said that India's focus should be on domestic reforms rather than tariff battles as it looks to become a global hub for manufacturing.

Mumbai local passengers sing Coldplay track while returning from concert. VideoMumbai-based content creator Moksha Shah, who attended the Coldplay concert, recorded the moment on the local train and shared a video of it on Instagram.

Spotlight on Barron as Americans talk of Trump's political successorUS President Donald Trump's son Barron has stepped out of his father's shadows and into America's political imagination. As the youngest Trump garnered attention after his father's shout-out, people speculated if he would be the inheritor of Trump's political legacy. This is all about Barron Trump, who has a towering presence.

Adar Poonawalla on 70-hour workweek: Humans can't be productive beyond 8-9 hoursThe CEO of Serum Institute mentioned that there's no substitute for hard work but the quality of work, and working strategically is of importance.

Saif attacker's cap found in son Jeh's room, hair under it sent for DNA analysisMohammad Shariful Islam Shehzad allegedly broke into actor Saif Ali Khan's Bandra home on January 16 and stabbed him multiple times. A cap has been found inside the actor's youngest son's room, where the attacker was first spotted.

Brazil drought sparks surge in global coffee pricesExtreme heat and prolonged drought in Brazil's coffee-growing regions have slashed yields and sent arabica prices soaring to their highest in nearly 50 years. From struggling organic farms to scorched plantations, the crisis is rippling across global markets, making coffee a costly luxury for consumers worldwide.

Is Trump supplying ammo to expansionist China via Panama Canal?Donald Trump's aggressive stance on the Panama Canal risks setting a dangerous precedent. It could offer China a blueprint to justify its territorial ambitions. Critics say Trump's stance could embolden Beijing's expansionism in Taiwan and the South China Sea, and undermine decades of American preaching of military restraint to China.

Israeli army chief of staff takes responsibility for Oct 7 security lapse, resignsHerzi Halevi said he would complete the Israel Defence Forces' inquiries into the October 7 attack by Hamas and strengthen the Israeli Defense Forces's readiness for security challenges.

'If eating beef is right, why not Gomutra,' asks former Tamil Nadu BJP chief BJP leader Tamilisai Soundararajan questioned the criticism of cow urine's medicinal use, amid backlash against IIT Madras Director's comments. Critics slammed his claims about gomutra's health benefits.

Tillotama Shome's Baksho Bondi to compete at Berlin International Film FestivalTillotama Shome's film Baksho Bondi (Shadowbox) is set to compete in the 75th Berlin International Film Festival. The film will also have its premiere at the prestigious event.

Rajnath Singh praises Akshay Kumar's Sky Force after screening, actor thanks himDefence Minister Rajnath Singh praised Akshay Kumar's upcoming film Sky Force. The movie showcases the Indian Air Force's bravery during the 1965 War.

Ramayana The Legend of Prince Rama to be screened at Maha Kumbh 2025Ramayana: The Legend of Prince Rama will be screened at the Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj on January 22 for school children and devotees.

Pics: Malaika Arora, Nora Fatehi leave fans spellbound with their dance face-offNora Fatehi and Malaika Arora set the internet ablaze with their sizzling dance moves on a dance reality show. Pictures from their face-off have emerged online.

sports.headline: Carlo Ancelotti breaks silence on his Real Madrid future: Not for me to decideReal Madrid head coach Carlo Ancelotti addressed his future at the La Liga club amid reports that he was planning to leave Madrid at the end of the season.

2nd T20I: Free metro travel announced for ticket holders in Chennai India vs England, 2nd T20I: The Tamil Nadu Cricket Association has announced free metro travel to and from the MA Chidambaram Stadium for ticket holders on Saturday, January 25.

Additional security for Rohit Sharma's first Ranji game in a decadeIndia skipper Rohit Sharma's Ranji Trophy comeback match for Mumbai will feature additional security and seating arrangements for up to 500 people.

Day 11 Order of Play: Jannik Sinner headlines second set of quarterfinalsThe 2025 Australian Open resumes on Wednesday, with top seed and defending champion Jannik Sinner leading the action in the second set of quarter-finals in Melbourne.

Carlos Alcaraz reveals biggest mistake in quarterfinal vs Novak DjokovicCarlos Alcaraz was knocked out of the Australian Open 2025 after losing to Novak Djokovic in the quarterfinal of the competition. Alcaraz reviewed his game and revealed his biggest mistake in the match.

Djokovic says beating Alcaraz 'huge win' for relationship with coach MurrayAustralian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic said his relationship with coach Andy Murray is getting better with every passing day and the win against Carlos Alcaraz in the quarterfinal will only help further the bond.

Australian Open: Murray consoles Carlos Alcaraz after loss vs Novak DjokovicNovak Djokovic's coach Andy Murray consoled young Carlos Alcaraz after the Spaniard was beaten in the quarter-finals of the Australian Open 2025. Alcaraz lost the quarters vs Djokovic despite winning the first set of the match.

2 arms, 1.5 legs: How Djokovic battled injury to beat Alcaraz Australian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic talked about how he dealt with his leg injury during the match against Carlos Alcaraz on Tuesday. Djokovic lost the opening set before he made a comeback to book a berth in the semi-final of the hard court major.

Champions Trophy: Karachi, Lahore stadiums face litmus Test in tri-seriesThe under-construction Karachi and Lahore stadiums will be handed to the Pakistan Cricket Board on 5 February, two weeks ahead of ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Pakistan will play a tri-series against South Africa and New Zealand in the renovated stadiums.

ICC boss Jay Shah meets Olympic Committee head Thomas Bach ahead of LA 2028International Cricket Council chief Jay Shah met the head of the International Olympic Committee, Thomas Bach. Shah met the IOC head in Switzerland, the images of which were released by the ICC.

Don't feel hurt by Champions Trophy exclusion: Suryakumar YadavSuryakumar Yadav addressed his exclusion from India's 15-member squad for the ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025. Suryakumar has not played an ODI for India since the 2023 World Cup final against Australia.

Manchester City sign 19-year-old Vitor Ries from Brazil's PalmeirasManchester City signed 19-year-old Vitor Reis from Palmeiras for 35 million euros, strengthening their squad with young talent. The Brazilian defender is part of Pep Guardiola's plan to build a future-ready team.

Aryna Sabalenka fights past Pavlyuchenkova to book semi-final berth Australian Open 2025: World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka kept alive her hopes of defending her crown at Melbourne Park after beating Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova in a thrilling three-setter in the quarterfinal.

Ashwin wants Jadeja to bat at No.4, Hardik Pandya at 5 in Champions TrophyChampions Trophy 2025: Ravichandran Ashwin has suggested a key change to India's batting line-up for the Champions Trophy. Ashwin has said that Ravindra Jadeja should bat at No.4 for India in the tournament.

Smriti Mandhana rises to No. 2 in ICC Women's ODI batting rankingsIndia opener Smriti Mandhana has jumped to the second position in the latest ICC women's ODI batting rankings after impressing in the series against Ireland.

Jos Buttler's England name playing XI for Kolkata T20I, Atkinson returns IND vs ENG, 1st T20I: Right-arm pacer Gus Atkinson made his comeback after 13 months as England named their playing XI for the series opener against India at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Jos Buttler says family support very important, reacts to BCCI's new rulesJos Buttler weighed in on the importance of family support during tours, contrasting the BCCI's new policy limiting players' family time. As India faces England in crucial fixtures, the debate highlights varying approaches to player well-being.

Suryakumar Yadav recalls KKR memories on his return to Eden Gardens for 1st T20IIndia's T20I skipper Suryakumar Yadav recalled his fond memories at the Eden Gardens, Kolkata ahead of the first T20I against England.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
